alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 2:54PM EDT until July 25 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN COOS...NORTHEASTERN GRAFTON AND NORTHEASTERN CARROLL COUNTIES... At 254 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Berlin to Bethlehem, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Littleton, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Franconia, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Carroll, Gorham, Lisbon, Jefferson, Dalton, Jackson, Chatham, Whitefield, Sugar Hill, Milan, Shelburne, Randolph and Stark. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 113 and 122. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
